programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Winnipeg Jets at Dallas Stars
programme.desc: Winnipeg Jets at Dallas Stars in Game 6 of a Western Conference second-round series. From American Airlines Center. The Stars return to Texas still one win away from a conference finals rematch with Edmonton, having been blanked by Connor Hellebuyck in their last two games on Jets ice. Stars winger Mikko Rantanen remains the NHL playoff scoring leader with 19 points and nine goals. Winnipeg is mired in a nine-game road losing streak in the playoffs.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 7: St. Louis Blues vs. Winnipeg Jets
programme.desc: St. Louis Blues vs. Winnipeg Jets in Game 7 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Canada Life Centre. The first-ever NHL Game 7 in Manitoba will send one of these teams into the second round, following six straights wins by the home team. St. Louis knotted the series with a 5-2 triumph two nights ago in which they chased Jets star goalie Connor Hellebuyck after two periods.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Carolina Hurricanes vs. New Jersey Devils
programme.desc: Carolina Hurricanes vs. New Jersey Devils in Game 3 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Prudential Center. The 'Canes blow into Newark with a 2-0 series lead, built on two stellar performances by goaltender Frederik Andersen (1.00 GAA), as well as Jordan Martinook's electric shorthanded game-winning goal midway through Game 2. Carolina is 5-13 on the road the last three postseasons, with this series the sixth in that span against a team in the New York metro area.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: New Jersey Devils vs. Carolina Hurricanes
programme.desc: New Jersey Devils vs. Carolina Hurricanes in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Lenovo Center. Seventh-year forward Andrei Svechnikov came alive with a hat trick in Game 4 as Carolina took a 3-1 series lead and now looks to extend its first-round home dominance under Rod Brind'Amour. Pyotr Kochetkov saw his first action in net for the Canes in relief of ailing Fred Andersen.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Florida Panthers vs. Tampa Bay Lightning
programme.desc: Florida Panthers vs. Tampa Bay Lightning in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference first-round series. From Amalie Arena. A stunning blitz of goals in the last minutes of Game 4 gave the reigning-champion Panthers a 3-1 series lead as Tampa Bay stares at first-round elimination for a third straight year. Florida has scored the first goal in all four contests, with Anton Lundell doing so in Game 4.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 7: Florida Panthers at Toronto Maple Leafs
programme.desc: Florida Panthers at Toronto Maple Leafs in Game 7 of an Eastern Conference second-round series. From Scotiabank Arena. Craig Berube's Leafs come home looking to snap their six-game losing streak in Game 7s, having last won one in 2004 vs. Ottawa. Third-period goals by captain Auston Matthews and veteran winger Max Pacioretty beat Florida 2-0 in Game 6, forcing the fifth Game 7 for the Panthers, who improved to 3-1 in deciding games when beating Edmonton to win last season's Stanley Cup.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Florida Panthers at Carolina Hurricanes
programme.desc: Florida Panthers at Carolina Hurricanes in Game 5 of the Eastern Conference Final. From Lenovo Center. Star defenseman Jaccob Slavin and the 'Canes willed the series back to Raleigh with a 3-0 must-win in Game 4, staving off Florida's first bid for a third straight trip to the Cup Final. Fredrik Andersen stopped all 20 Panthers shots as Carolina got its first win a conference final since 2006.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers
programme.desc: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers in Game 1 of the NHL's best-of-seven championship series. From Rogers Place. The first rematch in the Cup Final since 2009 (Red Wings-Penguins) pits Paul Maurice's defending-champion Panthers against Edmonton and perennial MVP candidates Leon Draisaitl and Connor McDavid. The Oilers famously rallied from a 3-0 series hole before falling 2-1 in Game 7 last June.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers
programme.desc: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers in Game 2 of the NHL's best-of-seven championship series. From Rogers Place. The Oilers rallied from a 3-1 hole to take Game 1 in overtime as Leon Draisaitl scored the game's first and last goals. Edmonton peppered Panthers goalie Sergei Bobrovsky with 46 shots and snapped Florida's five-game road win streak this postseason. Sam Bennett scored twice in defeat.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers in Game 3 of the NHL championship series. From Amerant Bank Arena. The defending champs skate home tied 1-1 with Edmonton after splitting two overtime games. Veteran Brad Marchand ended Game 2 with an 89th minute goal to go with an earlier shorthanded go-ahead goal. Sergei Bobrovsky made 42 saves in the win for Florida, which is just 4-3 at home this postseason.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers in Game 4 of the NHL championship series. From Amerant Bank Arena. Paul Maurice's Panthers are halfway to repeating as Cup champions after dominating Edmonton 6-1 in Game 3, with Sam Bennett and Brad Marchand both scoring their fourth goals of the series. Sergei Bobrovsky stopped 32 shots by the Oilers, who fell to 1-4 in the Sunshine State in Cup Final games. Edmonton star Leon Draisaitl was held without a shot on goal, while teammate Evan Bouchard had nine.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers
programme.desc: Florida Panthers at Edmonton Oilers in Game 5 of the NHL championship series. From Rogers Place. This scintillating best-of-seven skates back to Canada tied 2-2 after Oilers goalie Calvin Pickard (7-0 this postseason) stopped 22 of 23 Florida shots in relief in Game 4, allowing Leon Draisaitl to deposit his NHL-record fourth overtime goal of the postseason for a 5-4 victory.

programme.title: Stanley Cup Final
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers
programme.desc: Edmonton Oilers at Florida Panthers in Game 6 of the NHL championship series. From Amerant Bank Arena. Up 3-2, the Panthers are one win away from repeating as Cup champions and bringing the Sunshine State its fourth NHL title in six years. Florida foiled the Oilers 5-2 in Game 5 behind hot scorers Brad Marchand and Sam Bennett, and have an 8-0 edge in first-period scoring the last three games.

programme.sub-title: Game 2: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets
programme.desc: Los Angeles Clippers at Denver Nuggets in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Ball Arena. Denver's Russell Westbrook stung his previous Clippers mates with late clutch play in a 112-110 Game 1 overtime win. Nikola Jokic chipped in three of the Nuggets' 11 steals, to go with a game-high 29 points and 12 assists. James Harden's 32 points topped L.A., which blew a 15-point lead.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Clippers
programme.desc: Denver Nuggets at Los Angeles Clippers in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Intuit Dome. L.A. is up 2-1 in a best-of-seven that began with two nail-biting finishes in Denver before the Clippers sailed to a 117-83 Game 3 win in their raucous new home in Inglewood. Nic Batum had four of L.A.'s 18 made three-pointers, to just seven for the Nuggets.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Chase Center. Steve Kerr's Warriors are up 2-1, halfway to their eighth first-round series win in the last eight tries. Steph Curry's 36 points and nine assists fueled a 104-93 win in Game 3 as Golden State weathered an early 13-point Rockets lead, and overcame 31-percent shooting from long range.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets
programme.desc: Golden State Warriors at Houston Rockets in Game 5 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Toyota Center. Steve Kerr's Warriors return to Texas with a 3-1 series edge, looking to close out the young Rockets who fell 109-106 in Game 4 despite eight threes from Fred VanVleet. Jimmy Butler's 27 points sparked Golden State in his return from injury, sinking 12-of-12 free throws.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 6: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors
programme.desc: Houston Rockets at Golden State Warriors in Game 6 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Chase Center. Steph Curry and the veteran Dubs take a second shot at closing out youthful Houston, which held serve in Game 5 with a 131-116 home win sparked by Amen Thompson's 25 points and five steals. Golden State's starters totaled just 40 points as the Rockets built a lead as big as 31.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 1 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Now wearing Lakers gold, Luke Doncic tries to oust Anthony Edwards and Minnesota for a second straight postseason after willing Dallas to a 4-1 win in the 2024 West finals. Twenty years earlier was the T-Wolves' last playoff meeting with the Lakers, a 4-2 West finals loss.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 2 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. Anthony Edwards and the T-Wolves try to replicate their fine form from a 117-95 win in Game 1, the Lakers' first at home since 2012. Minnesota shot 21-for-42 from long range, including six threes from Naz Reid. Newest Laker Luka Doncic tallied 37 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 3 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Luka Doncic (31 points, 12 boards, 9 assists) and the Lakers clawed past the T-Wolves 94-85 in Game 2 to send the series north tied 1-1. This is the same court where Doncic (with Dallas) ended Minnesota's season last May with three road wins in the Western Conference finals.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves
programme.desc: Los Angeles Lakers at Minnesota Timberwolves in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Target Center. Chris Finch's T-Wolves have a 2-1 series edge after a spirited 13-1 closing run to take Game 3, 116-104. Fifth-year forward Jaden McDaniels scored a career playoff-high 30 points and helped clamp down on L.A.'s Luka Doncic. LeBron James tallied 38 in a losing effort.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers
programme.desc: Minnesota Timberwolves at Los Angeles Lakers in Game 5 of a Western Conference first-round series. From Crypto.com Arena. J.J. Redick's Lakers come home staring at elimination after a 116-113 T-Wolves win in Game 4 behind Anthony Edwards' 43 points and clutch late play from Jaden McDaniels. LeBron James scored 27, but none in the fourth quarter, which Minnesota has controlled in the series.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 3: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies in Game 3 of a Western Conference first-round series. From FedExForum. The Grizzlies return to Tennessee singin' the blues after an empty two-game trip to OKC in which the Thunder never trailed after the opening minutes of Game 1. Mark Daigneault's top-seeded squad committed just seven turnovers in Game 2 and had 16 steals/blocks to eight for Memphis.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 4: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies
programme.desc: Oklahoma City Thunder at Memphis Grizzlies in Game 4 of a Western Conference first-round series. From FedExForum. Top-seeded OKC survived a 29-point deficit in Game 3 en route to a 114-108 victory and a 3-0 series lead. Shai Gilgeous-Alexander scored 31 and Jalen Williams added 26, including the go-ahead free throw that game the Thunder their first lead with 1:20 to play. Scottie Pippen tallied 28 in defeat.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. Kenny Atkinson's top-seeded Cavs get back to action after sweeping their first-round series by an average of 30.5 points, with star guard Donovan Mitchell sharing the spotlight with Indiana's Tyrese Haliburton. Cleveland took the teams' last two playoff meetings in 2017 and 2018 (1st Rd.).

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 2: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 2 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. Indy drew first blood against the top-seeded Cavs with a 121-112 triumph capped by a 15-4 run in which guards Tyrese Haliburton (13 assists) and Andrew Nembhard (23 points) took over. Donovan Mitchell's record-setting eighth straight Game 1 with 30-plus points went for naught for Cleveland, which allowed the Pacers to shoot 19-for-36 on threes.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 5: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers
programme.desc: Indiana Pacers at Cleveland Cavaliers in Game 5 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From Rocket Arena. The top-seeded Cavs have their backs to the wall, down 3-1, with star guard Donovan Mitchell nursing an ankle injury after a blowout loss to Indiana in Game 4. Pacers big men Myles Turner and Pascal Siakam were 16-for-23 in the win, combining for 41 points in just 43 total minutes played.

programme.title: NBA Playoff
programme.sub-title: Game 1: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics
programme.desc: New York Knicks at Boston Celtics in Game 1 of an Eastern Conference semifinal series. From TD Garden. The 15th all-time playoff series between these division foes (7-7) is the first since 2013, with reigning-champion Boston having swept all four regular-season clashes with the Knicks. Jayson Tatum (31.2 ppg) and Jalen Brunson (31.5) set scorching scoring paces in the first round of the playoffs.

programme.desc: The 109th Running of the Indianapolis 500. From Indianapolis Motor Speedway. Robert Shwartzman is the first rookie in 43 years to start on pole, with two-time champ Takuma Sato and Pato O'Ward for company on Row 1. Kyle Larson starts 19th in his bid to become the fifth driver to complete this race and NASCAR's Coca-Cola 600 in Charlotte on the same day. Defending champ Josef Newgarden is in Row 11 alongside Penske Racing teammate Will Power after their cars were found with illegal modifications.
